name: Painting Numbers
description:
You are given 
    n
 integers, each integer is from 
    1
 to 
    n
, all
of them are pairwise distinct. You have to paint them red and blue (each
integer should have exactly one color). The cost of painting is the number of
pairs 
    (x, y)
 such that 
    y 
     x = 0
, 
    y
 is red and 
    x

is blue. For each 
    k 
    ∈ [1, n]
, calculate the maximum cost of painting
if exactly 
    k
 integers should have a red color. Input The first line
contains one integer 
    n
 (
    2 
    ≤ n 
    ≤ 10^5
). Output For each

    k 
    ∈ [1,n]
 print one integer — the maximum cost of painting, if
exactly 
    k
 integers should be red. Examples Input 6 Output 3 5 6 6 5 0
Input 2 Output 1 0 Input 11 Output 3 6 9 11 12 13 14 14 13 10 0
